summary: This document consists of Bureau of Prisons count sheets and inmate rosters from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 9, 2019. It records official inmate counts by housing unit and includes a roster noting an inmate assigned to 'HOSP' and others under 'SUICIDE OR' watch. This is significant as it provides administrative records from the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Daily Inmate Count at MCC New York
events.description: Official inmate count conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, recording a total census of 758 inmates across various housing units.

events.title: Inmate Hospital and Suicide Watch Assignment
events.description: Inmate roster shows assignments including one inmate to 'HOSP' and others to 'SUICIDE OR' (suicide observation) detail, indicating special monitoring protocols were in place.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Document is dated August 9, 2019, which is the day Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The records show a total inmate census of 758 at the MCC on that date.
An inmate roster includes assignments for 'HOSP' (hospital) and 'SUICIDE OR' (suicide observation), indicating active special monitoring protocols within the facility.
The documents are standard Bureau of Prisons administrative forms for official inmate counts and assignments.
No specific inmate names are listed in the provided text excerpts, only unit codes and assignment categories.
